query: Revenue sharing in California OR New York

result.cypher: MATCH (c:Contract)-[:CONTAINS]->(cl1:Clause)-[:OF_TYPE]->(ct1:ClauseType) WHERE ct1.name = 'Revenue/Profit Sharing' WITH c, cl1, ct1 MATCH (c)-[:CONTAINS]->(cl2:Clause)-[:OF_TYPE]->(ct2:ClauseType) WHERE ct2.name = 'Governing Law' AND (cl2.text =~ '(?i).*California.*' OR cl2.text =~ '(?i).*New York.*') RETURN c.id as c_id, c.title as c_title, c.num_clauses as c_num_clauses, c.context as c_context, cl1.id as cl1_id, cl1.text as cl1_text, ct1.name as revenue_clause_type, cl2.id as cl2_id, cl2.text as cl2_text, ct2.name as governing_law_type, CASE WHEN cl2.text =~ '(?i).*California.*' THEN 'California' WHEN cl2.text =~ '(?i).*New York.*' THEN 'New York' ELSE 'Other' END as jurisdiction ORDER BY jurisdiction, c.title LIMIT 50

analysis.summary: The query successfully identified contracts with revenue sharing clauses that are governed by either California or New York law. This demonstrates GraphRAG's ability to handle complex boolean logic (OR conditions) while maintaining relationship integrity between revenue sharing clauses and governing law clauses.
insights: Revenue sharing agreements in California and New York represent strategic market entries in key US markets.
The boolean logic query (revenue sharing AND (California OR New York)) successfully navigated multiple relationship types to find matching contracts.
Contracts with revenue sharing in these jurisdictions provide valuable competitive intelligence for market entry and pricing strategies.
riskFlags: Market-specific legal requirements may impact revenue sharing structures
Jurisdiction-specific contract terms may require specialized legal review
recommendations: Use these contracts as benchmarks for market-standard revenue sharing terms in California and New York markets.
Review jurisdiction-specific legal implications before structuring similar revenue sharing agreements.
Consider these examples when developing pricing strategies for market expansion in these regions.
